meanings.definition: Noticeable in an unwelcome or intrusive way.
meanings.sent1: The bright neon sign was so obtrusive that it hurt my eyes.
meanings.sent2: The loud music from the party next door was obtrusive and kept me awake all night.
meanings.sent3: The obtrusive squirrel kept stealing all the birdseed from the feeder.
meanings.sent4: Her obtrusive laughter echoed through the quiet library, drawing annoyed glances.
meanings.sent5: The obtrusive smell of burnt popcorn lingered in the hallway for hours.

meanings.definition: Tending to push oneself forward in an unwelcome manner.
meanings.sent1: His obtrusive behavior at the meeting made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The salesman's obtrusive attempts to sell me a product were off-putting.
meanings.sent3: The obtrusive cat kept trying to sit on my laptop while I was working.
meanings.sent4: Her obtrusive personality dominated every conversation, leaving no room for others to speak.
meanings.sent5: The obtrusive student always raised their hand before anyone else, eager to answer every question.
